column4: Just typical... I botched the network connection to my fathers Ubuntu Feisty... and hes 220 km's away... can anyone here help me troubleshoot... I have him on the phone, and Ive reached the end of my linux-capabilities...
opening network settings shows that the cable connection is selected...
what did you do?
well... the weird thing is that I was trying to set up his nvidia card using a remote desktop... didnt really do anything to his network settings...
ping www.yahoo.com
but he cant reach the internet at all!
so you say
hold on! :)
well, hes behind a router and he cant eveng access that...
can he ping the router?
well try!
well... got everything working by starting the older kernel in the GRUB!
nice
but the newest kernel worked before I messed things up...
can I reset the setting of the newer kernel?
v odd that a kernel stops networking, not sure what's wrong there
should I reinstall the nonkernel from synaptics?
why not stick with the kernel that works?
then you can fiddle when you have local access
well... perhaps youre right... I could set up GRUB to choose the older kernel by default...
best
could I at a later point reinstall hes computer with the ubuntu live CD in a way that keeps all users and mail setting and so on?
only when /home is on a separate partition, otherwise you'll have to back it up
oki!
